meanings.sent2: The thought of speaking in public daunts many people.
meanings.sent3: The tiny spider daunts the big, brave dog.
meanings.sent4: The towering mountain daunts even the most experienced climbers.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunderstorm daunts the young child.

meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose courage or resolution.
meanings.sent1: The failure daunts him from trying again.
meanings.sent2: The harsh criticism daunts her enthusiasm.
meanings.sent3: The broken pencil daunts the determined student.
meanings.sent4: The heavy workload daunts the ambitious worker.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected setback daunts their progress.
